text: James Andrew Broun-Ramsay, 1st Marquess of Dalhousie KT, PC (22 April 1812 â€“ 19 December 1860), known as The Earl of Dalhousie between 1838 and 1849, was a Scottish statesman and a colonial administrator in British India. He served as Governor-General of India from 1848 to 1856. He introduced the Doctrine of Lapse.Several independent Indian states were annexed under this policy- Satara,Nagpur,Jhansi and many others. Kingdoms like Awadh were annexed using a strategy known as misgovernment. Lord Dalhousie has made contributions to modern India by constructing railways and roads.He built the first railway line which was between Bombay and Thane.He passed The Hindu Remarriage Act in 1856.
